org.upmc.obolink.controller

Class LoginController

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.upmc.obolink.controller.LoginController

  • @Controller
public class LoginController
extends java.lang.Object
    The controller who will handle everything associated with the login and registration.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LoginController(UserService userService)

    • Method Detail

      • login

        @RequestMapping(value={"/","/login"},
                method=GET)
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView login()
        Handle the request GET when accessing the "/" or the "/login" page of the website.
        Returns:
        If the user is not logged, it will return login.html. If the user is logged, then he will be redirected to "/association"
        See Also:
        RobotController.assoc()

      • registration

        @RequestMapping(value="/registration",
                method=GET)
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView registration()
        Handle the request GET when accessing "/registration" page of the website.
        Returns:
        If the user is not logged, it will return registration.html. If the user is logged, then he will be redirected to "/association"
        See Also:
        RobotController.assoc()

      • createNewUser

        @RequestMapping(value="/registration",
                method=POST)
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView createNewUser(User user,
                                                                                                                                      org.springframework.validation.BindingResult bindingResult)
        Handle the request POST send by the registration form. If the data filed by the user is good, a new User will be created.
        Parameters:
        user - The form data filed by the user.
        bindingResult - Allow to send errors to the user.
        Returns:
        Send a success message or errors to the user to be display.
        See Also:
        User

      • home

        @RequestMapping(value="/admin/home",
                method=GET)
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView home()
        Handle the request GET when accessing "/admin/home" page of the website.
        Returns:
        If the user is logged has an admin, home/admin.html will be send.

      • accessDenied

        @RequestMapping(value="access-denied",
                method=GET)
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView accessDenied()
        Handle the request GET when accessing "/admin/home" page of the website. Most of the time, the user will be redirected to this page when he tries to access a forbidden web page.
        Returns:
        access-denied.html
